raw_text: Vector-based models of word co-occurrence have proved a useful representational framework for a variety of natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as word sense discrimination (Sch ?tze, 1998), text segmentation (Choi et al, 2001), contextual spelling correction (Jones and Martin, 1997), automatic thesaurus extraction (Grefenstette, 1994), and notably information retrieval (Salton et al, 1975)

citing_paper_authors: Xiaoming, Lu | Lei, Xie | Cheung-Chi, Leung | Bin, Ma | Haizhou, Li
raw_text: Probabilistic latent semantic analysis (PLSA) (Hofman n, 1999) is a typical instance and used widely.PLSA is the probabilistic variant of latent semantic analysis (LSA) (Choi et al, 2001), and offers a more solid statistical foundation
clean_text: PLSA is the probabilistic variant of latent semantic analysis (LSA) (Choi et al, 2001), and offers a more solid statistical foundation.

raw_text: Choi at al. used LSA for segmentation (Choietal., 2001)
clean_text: Choi at al. used LSA for segmentation (Choi et al., 2001).

raw_text: (Choiet al, 2001) used all vocabulary words to compute low-dimensional document vectors
clean_text: (Choi et al, 2001) used all vocabulary words to compute low-dimensional document vectors.

raw_text: (Choi et al, 2001) used clustering to predict boundaries whereas we used the average similarity scores
clean_text: (Choi et al, 2001) used clustering to predict boundaries whereas we used the average similarity scores.

citing_paper_authors: Josef, Steinberger | Mijail, Alexandrov-Kabadjov | Massimo, Poesio | Olivia, Sanchez-Graillet
raw_text: It is a very powerful technique already used for NLP applications such as information retrieval (Berry et al, 1995) and text segmentation (Choi et al, 2001) and, more recently, multi and single-document summarization. The approach to using LSA in text summarization we followed in this paper was proposed in (Gong and Liu, 2002)
clean_text: It is a very powerful technique already used for NLP applications such as information retrieval (Berry et al, 1995) and text segmentation (Choi et al, 2001) and, more recently, multi and single-document summarization.

raw_text: In CWM (Choi et al, 2001), a variant of C99, each word of a sentence is replaced by its representation in a Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) space
clean_text: In CWM (Choi et al, 2001), a variant of C99, each word of a sentence is replaced by its representation in a Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) space.

raw_text: Examples include automatic thesaurus extraction (Grefenstette, 1994), word sense discrimination (Schu ?tze, 1998) and disambiguation (McCarthy et al, 2004), collocation extraction (Schone and Jurafsky, 2001), text segmentation (Choi et al, 2001), and notably information retrieval (Salton et al, 1975)

citing_paper_authors: Shafiq R., Joty | Giuseppe, Carenini | Gabriel, Murray | Raymond T., Ng
raw_text: While extensive research has been con ducted in topic segmentation for monologues (e.g., (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), (Choi et al, 2001)) and synchronous dialogs (e.g., (Galley et al, 2003), (Hsueh et al, 2006)), none has studied the problem of segmenting asynchronous multi-party conversations (e.g., email)
clean_text: While extensive research has been conducted in topic segmentation for monologues (e.g., (Malioutov and Barzilay, 2006), (Choi et al, 2001)) and synchronous dialogs (e.g., (Galley et al, 2003), (Hsueh et al, 2006)), none has studied the problem of segmenting asynchronous multi-party conversations (e.g., email).

raw_text: The CWMalgorithm (Choi et al, 2001) applies the same procedure to a similarity matrix of LSI vectors
clean_text: The CWM algorithm (Choi et al, 2001) applies the same procedure to a similarity matrix of LSI vectors.

raw_text: As a preliminary test of the error measure, Ievaluated two algorithms from Choi et al (2001) on 995 the standard segmentation data set that Choi (2000) compiled
clean_text: As a preliminary test of the error measure, I evaluated two algorithms from Choi et al (2001) on the standard segmentation data set that Choi (2000) compiled.

raw_text: The C99 (Choi, 2000) and CWM (Choi et al, 2001) algorithms were evaluated
clean_text: The C99 (Choi, 2000) and CWM (Choi et al, 2001) algorithms were evaluated.
